page.title: 14THE AIRPORT EASTLEIGH
page.content: 1908 saw the first recorded flight from this airfield, making it probably the oldest in Britain. The airport has one concrete runway of almost 1700m in length.It can accept aircraft up to the size of Boeing 737's. 0.33 million passengers use the airport every year and there are 48,000 aircraft movements.Destinations include the Channel Islands,Paris and Amsterdam. Air U.K. are the main operators with H.P.Heralds,Fokker F27's and Short 360 aircraft. Aurigny Air Services operate scheduled services to Alderney with BN3 Islander aircraft. The Airport is privately owned and is operated by British Airports International.Approximately 200 people are employed at the Airport and it also has an industrial estate used mostly by transport and storage firms.
